intro: Palaquium vitilevuense, commonly known as the Viti Levu palm, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Viti Levu in Fiji. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of botanical interest. Due to its limited distribution, it is also considered a rare species.
